subject: Re: [junit] Testing a class with private constructor
msgSnippet: True.  I ve found myself often refactoring away from the strict singleton to something more open to testing. I forgot to mention in my last message - a
messageBody:
True. I've found myself often refactoring away from the strict
singleton to something more open to testing.

I forgot to mention in my last message - a type-safe enum would be
another case where a private constructor is ideal, and where you would
not want to public-ize it. Maybe the original poster could chime in
with the details of the object under test.

- Rob

On 6/23/05, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
> Robert Sanheim wrote:
>
> > I'm guessing the object is a singleton or something simliar - in which
> > case you would not want to make the constructor public - especially
> > for the purposes of testing only.
>
> That's true, but then again:
>
> http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/webservices/library/co-single.html
>
> Short version: Most of the time, we /think/ it should be a singleton,
> but it doesn't have to be and shouldn't be.
